column5: Thinking of going out tomorrow morning with the canoe. Thinking of hitting mitchell or canal for some pike, bass and maybe some shore musky. I just want to get into a setting like the kawarthas for a while and try for some pike before it gets too cold. What do you guys think? (would have to be within an hours drive) Thanks!
Might be too windy to be in a canoe tomorrow. 8-22kts according to windfinder in orillia
What about the Holland river/canal in Bradford?,sheltered,not much musky thou.
PD day or skipping class  agree with davey, sheltered river might be best option, unless it lines up with the blow
Home schooled remember?  The holland's a little ugly this time of year what about going a little further to big chute? Would it be sheltered enough?
you're home schooled ? cool. toronto islands maybe ?
You will have to join us one evening shortly for crappie.Usually from about 8pm-midnight or so .What a lot of fun.That area should be getting busy soon if not already.
Big chute or holland? Either way I'd love to! Maybe I'll just opt for some shore exploration tomorrow.
Shoot me a PM once they start to heat up.
Alright, decided to go to the islands tomorrow morning. Anyone want to meet up? Shoot me a pm if interested.
Kid, why aren't you in school?
So how did you make out today Christopher ? Esox in the city ?
As we were driving down we realized that I had to volunteer at the school today, Thanksgiving monday really messes you up.
So you had to work around the house all day then?
No, the elementary school down the street, I teach robotics there.
